Experience

The intimate & peaceful Papaya Lake Lodge is located close to Kibale National Park & Queen Elizabeth Park, where exhilarating chimpanzee treks & sights of the red colobus monkey can be enjoyed.
Papaya Lake Lodge offers sweeping views of Lyantonde & Kifuruka Lakes within Uganda’s Great Crater Lakes region.

Stay

This small & intimate lodge features 9 exclusive cottages with tranquil & luxurious spaces as well as bespoke décor.
All cottages have en-suite bathrooms & inviting verandas. One of these cottages boasts 2 storeys, 3 bedrooms, a living room & spacious terrace.
The main lodge area includes a lounge, dining room, bar & swimming pool where guests can relax while enjoying the remarkable beauty of the extinct volcano lakes.

Activities

A variety of exciting activities are available, including day trips to the 9 crater lakes, community village visits, a motorcycle adventure to 12 crater lakes, bird watching & a leisurely hike to the Rwenzori Mountains & hot springs.

subfolders.title: Ndali Lodge
subfolders.description: Ndali Lodge is perched on the edge of an extinct volcano, which over centuries has been filled with water to become the vast Lake Nyinambuga in the Bunyaruguru Crater Field in Uganda. This rustic & intimate lodge prides itself on its relaxed & friendly atmosphere, ensuring that its guests feel right at home throughout their stay.  The staff are locals who come from nearby villages & have been professionally trained to ensure excellent service.

subfolders.title: Turaco Treetops Lodge
subfolders.description: Turaco Treetops Lodge is a luxury lodge set in the lush rainforest neighbouring Uganda’s Kibale National Park.   With uninterrupted views over the snow-capped Rwenzori Mountains & Kibale Forest, Turaco Treetops Lodge is the ideal place to immerse yourself in nature & experience an Uganda safari of note.
